Sun, sweat push mercury to real feel 50\.description: Bhubaneswar: The heatwave has returned to the state with vengeance accompanied by the oppressive humidity. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued yellow alert for the heatwave in 10 districts till June 13 and advised people to avoid exposure to the sun. The high humidity levels made life difficult for people of the city. Though the maximum day temperature was between 38°C and 42°C, the temperature felt like 48°C to 50°C. “It was difficult to stay outdoors for more than half an hour. I felt sick due to the constant sweating,” said Prafulla Kumar Mishra, a government employee. On Monday, the city recorded a maximum relative humidity of 94%. At 8.30 am, the humidity was as high as 82 %. It stood at 78% at 5.30 pm. “Neither the morning hours were comfortable nor the day time nor the evening. The unscheduled power cuts several times during the day are adding to our woes,” said Madhabi Lata Patra of Kanan Vihar. The weatherman, however said, high humidity during the pre-monsoon period is quite normal. “Wind pattern changes during the transition period from May-end till the onset of monsoon in June causing change in weather. The south and south-easterly wind prevailing in the state is carrying lots of moisture that is causing the discomfort,” said H R Biswas, director of IMD, Bhubaneswar office. The highest maximum temperature of 44.8°C was recorded at Hirakud followed by 44.6°C at Sambalpur on Monday. Bhubaneswar recorded maximum temperature of 37.4°C . Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Puri temple admn draws criticism for pro.description: Bhubaneswar: Though the Sri Jagannath Temple Administration (SJTA) on Tuesday aborted its move to auction telecast of the world famous Puri Rath Yatra following public pressure, the administration wants its pie from TV channels’ profits from broadcasting the religious sojourn. “The channels will share a part of their profit. I will soon convene a meeting of the channel heads to decide how much they will pay, ” said SJTA chief administrator Pradipta Mohapatra, while announcing that all channels will be allowed to telecast the festival that witnesses a congregation of lakhs of devotees. The profit-sharing formula has invited strong criticism. Ashok Mohapatra, legal adviser of Gobardhan Pitha, the seat of Puri Shankaracharya Swami Nischalananda Saraswati, said the administration should not be greedy about what profits the channels are making. “How can they ask for profit from channels that telecast the yatra on Grand Road, the public place that is open for all. Similarly, they may ask shopkeepers on Grand Road to part with their profit with the temple on the pretext that their customers are devotees. This is unacceptable.” Gobardhan Pitha has filed an intervening petition in a PIL that is being heard by the Supreme Court on mismanagement and exploitation of devotees in the Jagannath Temple. Hearing the PIL in April, the SC had questioned government authorities’ control in managing the temple affairs. Mohapatra, who is also vice-president of Mukti Mandap Pandit Sabha, an advisory body on disputes of religious and social nature in Puri temple, said channels making profits are anyway complying with tax norms. “Puri temple should not be seen as a state museum for a revenue model,” he said. Ramakrushna Dasmohapatra, president of Daitapati Niyog, a priest body, said nobody should be forced to pay. “Any contribution to the Lord at best should be voluntary,” he said. Pritish Acharya, a professor of history, said all forms of commercialisation of the temple should be discouraged. “Otherwise there will be no end to it,” he said. Senior functionary of a private TV channel, who did not wish to be named, said they would wait till the SJTA meeting before making any comment on the issue. JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. All-party meet ahead of Odisha assembly.description: BHUBANESWAR: Speaker Surya Narayan Patro plans to hold an all-party meeting either on June 23 or 24 before the start of the budget session of the assembly to seek cooperation for the smooth running of the house. Though such practices are very common before the start of Lok Sabha sessions, Odisha assembly has not witnessed any such move by a speaker in recent history. In Odisha, all party meetings were convened only when there are logjams. “It is the speaker’s duty to listen to members of all political parties to understand their issues. An all-party meeting will be held before start of the session to seek cooperation from all for smooth- running of the house. Important issues will be discussed,” Patro told reporters here. Congress veteran Narasingha Mishra and senior BJP leader Jayanarayan Mishra welcomed the speaker’s decision. The legislature meetings of all the three major parties, BJD, BJP and Congress, will also be held on June 24. The first session of the 16th assembly will start from June 25 with the address of Governor Ganeshi Lal. Finance minister Niranjan Pujari will present the annual budget for 2019-20 fiscal on June 28. The session will have 30 working days in two phases. With at least 63 MLAs elected to the assembly for the first-time, the assembly secretariat will hold one-day training programme for the new MLAs to help them understand various procedures of house functioning. Later in Sepetember, a three-day training programme will be conducted for the new legislators, said Patro. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Statue ofMahatmavandalised.description: Balasore: A statue of Mahatma Gandhi was found vandalised in Sovarampur government nodal upper primary school in Balasore district. It came to light when locals entered the school premises on Sunday after they noticed that some trees had been felled inside the compound. President, school managing committee, Surendra Singh, said, “Five anti-socials entered the school on June 14 evening. They vandalised the statue installed in 2006 besides ransacking the school and its garden,” he said. “A room christened ‘Bapuji Kakhya’ in the school in honour of the ‘Father of the Nation’ was also ransacked. Cigarette butts and empty liquor bottles were strewn on the floor,” he added. Sailabala Rout, headmistress of the school said after school hours, the anti-socials enter the premises with liquor and drugs. IIC of Sahadevkhunta police station S S Nayak said the incident is suspected to have taken place on June 14 and could be the handiwork of anti-socials as the school was shut for the summer vacation. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Doctors strike.description: KOLKATA: Junior doctors in Bengal finally called off their week-long strike and promised to resume duty on Tuesday morning, ending a stir that crippled out patient departments (OPDs) and severely hit emergency services at hospitals across the state. At a meeting held at state secretariat Nabanna on Monday evening, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee told a team of 31 junior doctors, " Lakkhi chhele, ebar tomra strike tule nao (Please withdraw your strike like good boys)", which they agreed to. The "cordial" negotiations between the CM and doctors were broadcast live for about 100 minutes by two regional channels. The doctors, who had adopted a strident posture against the administration for the initial police inaction against the kin of a bereaved patient at NRS Hospital last Monday (incident that triggered the stir) relented in the face of genuine-sounding assurances from the CM. The state administration medical fraternity face-off escalated after Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee issued a stern warning of action against the strike during her visit to SSKM Hospital last Thursday. What could have also played on their minds was the rising public opinion against the continuing strike, especially after the CM's appeal for talks last weekend. The striking doctors returned to the NRS campus on Monday and, after another general-body meeting, made a statement: "We hereby announce the withdrawal of the strike by junior doctors." Several issues were discussed at the meeting. They ranged from security measures - collapsible gates for emergency wards, regulated entry for patients' kin and enhanced police presence on medical campuses with nodal officers responsible for law and order - to the CM's suggestion for third-party PR professionals, who could act as grief counsellors and handle communication between "overworked doctors" and "aggrieved patients' kin" and grievance cells for patients. "We are delighted with the cordial manner in which the meeting was held, the CM's caring touch and concrete suggestions and assurances to the issues raised by us," one of the junior doctors said. "They (doctors) have genuine demands. We have listened to them and taken decisions to resolve them. This must be a continuous process. We have to see to it that such untoward incidents are averted and action is taken if something happens," Mamata said. The CM's "gentleness", however, came with the message that she could not be bullied. Urged by the junior doctors to visit the doctor who was injured in the NRS attack, and come to the NRS campus, she said, "Leave certain things to us...Give me your word that you will resume duty." In Video:CM Mamata accepts proposal of doctors to set up Grievance Redressal CellDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. Puri temple douses auction fire, allows.description: Bhubaneswar: The Shree Jagannath Temple Administration (SJTA) on Tuesday said it would allow all TV channels to telecast the July 4 Rath Yatra, ending the raging controversy it had earlier sparked by inviting bidders for telecast rights of the annual festival. This incidentally comes a day after Prasanna Kumar Dash, a Puri-based social activist, moved the high court against auctioning of telecast rights for the Rath Yatra. Earlier, the SJTA had received seven bids from different TV channels. The highest bid of Rs 54 lakh was quoted by a local private news channel. SJTA chief administrator Pradipta Mohapatra told media persons in Puri, “We will allow all channels to telecast the Rath Yatra. We will have a meeting with them shortly.” He added, “The channels will be asked to share a part of their profit with the temple administration.” Referring to the now abandoned plan to auction telecast, Mohapatra said, “By floating the expression of interest, we could gauge the market value of the telecast of the event. We will discuss with TV channels how much they can pay to the temple.” The SJTA will ask for the names of TV commentators in advance. “Sometimes, some commentators give inaccurate facts. We want commentators with sufficient knowledge of Jagannath culture,” Mohapatra said. Ramakrushna Dasmohapatra, president of Daitapati Niyog (an organization of priests), said his organization was against the move to auction telecast rights. He added, “We had opposed a similar step in 2010. This time, the administartion decided to auction telecast rights. The Rath Yatra shouldn’t have limited coverage. Nor should it be commercialized.” Renowned Odissi dancer Saswat Joshi said in an age where digital platforms are being used to spread culture and heritage, there shouldn’t be any attempt to curtail telecast rights of channels for an event like the Rath Yatra. He added, “When I visit foreign countries, they are keen to know about the Rath Yatra. Lord Jagannath’s event can’t be used for commercial exploitation.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Odisha: Class XII board results next wee.description: BHUBANESWAR: The Class XII board exam results of humanities, commerce and vocational streams will be published either on June 17 or 18, school and mass education minister Samir Ranjan Dash said on Wednesday. The result of the science stream was announced on June 3. "Elections and Cyclone Fani had led to delay in the evaluation process owing to disruption in electricity and internet connections. After the situation normalised, the tabulation process was expedited," Dash said. As many as 2,35,183 students had appeared in humanities, 27,278 in commerce and 8,058 students in vocational stream. The exams were conducted by the Council of Higher Secondary Education (CHSE). The delay in publication of results of humanities and commerce has irked students. This has resulted in many of them not being able to apply in universities and institutions outside the state. Besides, the alleged partiality shown to science students has been a sticking point. Naveen meets NaMo, seeks special categor.description: Bhubaneswar: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday asked Prime Minister Narendra Modi to recognize states hit by major calamities as ‘special focus states’ and extend to them ‘the benefits of a special category state for a specific period’. Naveen raised the demands with Modi when the two met for the first time in New Delhi since the recent general elections. Earlier, the PM had praised Naveen’s deft handling of the post-Fani situation in Odisha. Official sources said Naveen proposed that his demands be accepted ‘until the Centre includes natural calamity as an indicator for according special category to a state’. Any state that gets special focus tag will be able to obtain funds for the central-sponsored schemes under the 90:10 sharing arrangement between it and the Centre. Naveen was of the view that such a provision would help the reconstruction of infrastructure and restoration of livelihood. “The move will not only help Odisha but any state of the country, which will be hit by a major natural calamity,” an official statement quoted Naveen as saying. The CM sought an assistance of Rs 5,000 crore for restoration work in Fani-hit areas and five lakh rural houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (gramin) on a 90:10 fund sharing pattern as a special case. After his nearly 20-minute meeting with Modi, Naveen told media persons, “I requested him for special category status for Odisha. We have been hard hit by the recent cyclone that caused a great deal of damage.” For many decades, Odisha has been seeking special status on grounds of various reasons such as difficult terrain, low population density and resource base, strategic location, economic and infrastructure backwardness and sizeable tribal population. Naveen reiterated his demand for revision of coal royalty from the existing 14% to 20%. The last revision was done in May 2012. He said they did not discuss the election of Lok Sabha deputy speaker. Earlier, there was widespread speculation that the NDA might offer the post to Bhartruhari Mahtab, BJD MP from Cuttack. The CM demanded reconstruction of damaged public infrastructure like high-tension power supply lines be brought under the ambit of national or state disaster funds. Naveen also called on President Ram Nath Kovind and apprised him of the devastation caused by Cyclone Fani and subsequent restoration work taken up his government. Odisha crime branch harps on prevention.description: BHUBANESWAR: To prevent escape of accused persons from police custody, the state Crime Branch has asked the superintendents of police (SPs) to remain alert when arrested persons are taken to hospital for medical examination, to court or jail. According to the recent Crime Branch letter to the SPs, a number of instances were reported where accused persons escaped from the police custody during their transit for appearance in the court. Crime Branch sources said at least 9 arrested persons escaped from the police custody in connection with separate crimes in 2018. “In cases of heinous offences, including Naxalism, it is a challenge for the police to safely produce the accused persons in court,” additional director general of police (Crime Branch) Santosh Upadhyay said. The Crime Branch’s concern assumes significance as an alleged Maoist had escaped from the police custody in Nuapada district last year, leaving the police red-faced. Manoj Madkami, who was arrested by Nuapada district police in May 2018, jumped the police custody from court premises on September 18, 2018. Madkami is still on the run. The incident had happened when Madkami was being taken back to jail from the court. At least seven cops were suspended for negligence and dereliction of duty. In order to avoid escape of hard core criminals, the Crime Branch has suggested the SPs to produce the former in court through electronic video linkage. Crime Branch said the concerned police stations should move the court, seeking approval to produce the accused via video conference. “We have electronic video linkage in the jails and courts. Since arrested persons are compulsorily produced in court in regular interval, the apprehension of their escape cannot be ruled out. Police stations should not take the risk of transporting dreaded criminals to court and use the technology for their safe appearance before the judge,” another Crime Branch officer said. Authorities in some jails and courts said the video linkage and internet connectivity was damaged after Cyclone Fani battered Odisha on May 3. Prisons officials said the technicians are already on the job to restore the service. “We have partly restored the service in some prisons,” a jail officer said. Odisha: Police to sensitize Nuapada peop.description: BHUBANESWAR: After witnessing a human sacrifice case in Komna area in Nuapada district, the district police have planned to create awareness among people against the blind belief including human or animal sacrifice for better harvest. Smith Parmar Parshottamdas, Nuapada SP, said the district police will organise a mini marathon like event in Komna involving local youth, students and other people for creating awareness about rational thinking and to stop superstitious rituals. He said Komna police station has ‘Ama Police Samiti’ and it will create sensitization programmes with community people against human or animal sacrifice. Senior citizens, youths, intellectuals, activists and students will take part in the discussions, he added. Ama Police Samiti is an initiative of the home department’s community policing scheme launched in 2013. According to its concept, police officers and citizens work together in a creative way to help solve contemporary community problems. “We will tell people that sacrifice ritual is illegal and cannot help them to give better harvest. They should test their soil before sowing seeds and apply manure or fertilizer to get good yield,” said the SP. Chintamani Majhi, 48, of Jadamunda village under Komna police station in the district sacrificed his 12-year-old nephew, Dhansingh, on Saturday for better harvest this Khariff season. This tribal farmer, who severed the boy’s head with the help of an axe, had confessed to the crime. A court on Sunday sent him in judicial custody. As an old belief, some tribal people in Nuapada practice choru (a local term for sacrifice) to get good yield. They sacrifice hen, goat or other animals. But killing a human being for choru is very rare, said a senior police officer. Meanwhile, deceased’s Saban Majhi reached the village. He was working as a daily wager in Andhra Pradesh to fund education expenses of his two sons including the deceased. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. In Video:Actress Urmila Matondkar meets Rahul Gandhi, joins CongressDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Odisha government nod to hike MBBS seats.description: BHUBNESWAR: The state government on Thursday gave its nod to implement 10% quota for economically weaker sections (EWS) in medical institutions from this academic year. To make it work, the government approved increasing MBBS seats in the state by 150 and post graduate (MD/MS) intake by 148. But the final call on increasing the exact number of seats would be taken by the Medical Council of India’s (MCI)s board of governors, sources said. “The government has given in-principle approval for the proposal to implement the quota. Further modalities will be worked out soon,” health secretary Pramod Meherda told TOI. Sources said the government has given its nod to increase MBBS seats at Veer Surendra Sai Institute of Medical Education and Research (VIMSAR), Burla, by 50 from its current capacity of 150. Similarly, 25 seats are going to be added to each of the medical colleges in Koraput, Baripada, Balasore and Balangir, taking the total intake to 125. The move follows a Union government directive wherein 10% EWS quota in general category needs to be implemented in higher education institutions. With the admission process under NEET scheduled to start soon, the states had to send their proposals to the MCI so that they can sync the intake capacity in various medical institutions with the Centre’s rules. Since the number of seats at SCB Medical College, Cuttack and MKCG Medical College and Hospital, Berhampur are already 250 each — the maximum allowed to any medical college under MCI norms — increasing their intake would not be possible, a government official said. The state has also given its nod to increase post graduate seats at SCB, MKCG and VIMSAR by 148. If the MCI board approves the proposal, the number of MBBS seats in state-run medical institutions will go up from 1,050 to 1,200 and PG intake from 468 to 616. The state had to come up with a revised proposal after withdrawing an earlier approval on seat increase sent to the MCI board on June 4 as the same was not as per the medical education regulator’s suggested formula. In the withdrawn approval, the state had suggested increasing MBBS seats by 105 and PG seats by 50. It must be mentioned that AIIMS Bhubaneswar, a central government-run institute, has already decided to increase its intake from 100 to 125 this year. \nPercussionist Jonqui and DJ Whosane!\u.description: It was a dazzling evening that many in Bhubaneswar hadn’t witnessed before. Brightly lit runway, leggy models, fashionable designer clothes, presence of a Bollywood celebrity and a happening after-party — it was a heady concoction for the who’s who of the city. During the fashion show organized at a city five star, the crowd cheered on while the models showcased the two designer’s creations. What more, percussionist Jonqui and DJ Whosane!’s fusion performance added an extra dimension to the show. “It’s my second visit to Bhubaneswar and I must confess that this city has changed a lot from my first visit. People here have started to have a nightlife. I’m glad that I could perform in front of this crowd. They were extremely appreciative,” said the curly haired percussionist Jonqui. DJ Whosane! also had a similar experience. “The crowd cheered loudly after I finished performing. Though I’ve been performing for a long time, this response from the Bhubaneswar crowd was a pleasant surprize for me,” said Whosane! Once the show got over, the party shifted to the crystal room of the hotel. Needless to say, the party animals were in high spirits. BT caught up with Sanu Sharma and his pretty wife Madhu and after posing for the shutterbugs, Sanu said, “We’re really enjoying ourselves and I wish this party never ends.” Young marketing executive Archana Sahu rejoiced the fact that this city is waking up for a nightlife. “We hardly get to attend parties in Bhubaneswar. So when we do, we make the most of it. I’m happy that we got a decent gathering here,” said Archana. What was pleasantly surprising was that former captain of Odisha Ranji cricket team Pravanjan Mallick, who had hit the headlines for slapping wife Cini, was seen enjoying with her at the party. Ollywood actor Sunita was also there in the attendance.Jyoti Prakash Naik & Madhusree GhoshDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors, medical students protest attack.description: BHUBANESWAR: Doctors and medical students in the state on Friday staged demonstrations and rally at different medical colleges and hospitals protesting attack on medicos at NRS Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata. Medical students, interns, junior residents and senior residents of AIIMS Bhubaneswar staged demonstration in front of the registration counter of the hospital expressing solidarity to their counterparts in West Bengal. They later took out a rally in the institute campus flaunting placards and shouting slogans like ‘we want justice’ and ‘save doctors’. “Physical violence along with government apathy is unacceptable for any individual in this country. The repeated atrocious acts of barbarism have propelled pan India strike and support to our younger brothers and sisters. We condemn the attack on doctors in Kolkata,” said a statement of Residents’ Doctor Association of the institute. Due to the token dharna, OPD services were affected. Consultation of doctors with patients got delayed. But later the junior doctors joined the senior doctors in the hospital service. “It was a token strike, so treatment of patients was not affected. Emergency and indoor patient service were normal,” said Sachidananda Mohanty, medical superintendent of the AIIMS Bhubaneswar. Members of the Indian Medical Association (IMA) state chapter staged a demonstration in front of the office here protesting attack on the doctors. “Expressing solidarity with doctors in West Bengal, IMA has given a strike call on June 17 across the country. We will discuss with our members and take a call on Saturday regarding this,” said Janmejay Mohapatra, honorary state secretary of IMA Odisha. IMA Rourkela chapter also staged demonstration expressing solidarity to the doctors in Kolkata. “Considering the consistent rise in violence against doctors and medical establishments, the IMA has been demanding for implementation of a national law, which should have a provision of at least seven year imprisonment for the hospital violence," said Ranjan Kumar Dutta, president, IMA Rourkela city chapter. Prabhat Rout, president of Junior Doctor Association of SCB Medical College and Hospital, said junior doctors in all medical colleges in the state showed their solidarity by wearing black badge. “We will call a meeting on Sunday and decide our next course of action,” he added. On Thursday, resident doctors and MBBS students at SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack had burnt effigy of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee protesting attack on their fellow doctors in the neighbouring state. Junior Doctors Associations (JDA) of all state-run medical colleges has strongly condemned the attack. (With inputs from Mihir Ray from Rourkela) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Schools asked to explain poor results in.description: BHUBANESWAR: To fix accountability for poor performance of schools in the Class X board exam, the school and mass education department has sought explanation from over 1,500 high schools with low results.  Notice has been issued to them as over 40% students have secured less than 30 % marks in each school. Headmasters of schools have been asked to give explanation within two weeks. Besides, information on a range of points have also been asked like students' learning abilities, standard of teachers and school infrastructure, said a senior officer in the school and mass education department. The department is preparing a detailed school-wise database based on the performance of children in the matric examination, he said. Official sources said while 82 schools in the state have scored nil results in the class X boards this year, in over 1,400 schools, students failed in one or more subjects. School and mass education minister Samir Ranjan Dash had told that he would personally visit the schools with nil results and find out the reason for the poor performance. This year, as many as 5,87,720 students took the annual high school certificate examination of whom 3,97,125 students cleared the exam with a pass percentage of 70.78. Among the passed out students around 1, 22,062 have secured less than 40% marks. According to an official, the no detention policy up to Class VIII is one of the reasons for a large number of students scoring low marks in matric exam. "Due to the no fail policy till Class VIII according to the Right to Education Act, there has been a drop in quality and in upper classes students face difficulties in grasping subjects leading to low scores," said Rajanikant Rout, a retired schoolteacher. The state government is planning to conduct an assessment test of students in the beginning of Class IX so that more focus can be given on weaker students by taking remedial measures and conducting extra classes for them. The assessment test will be conducted for mathematics, English and science subjects. Those who score less than 50% in the test will have to attend extra or remedial classes before the beginning of the session, the officer said. The parent-teacher meeting will be conducted in every 45 days instead of every six months. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nModels walked down the ramps in rainbo.description: It turned out to be a surprise for the party animals of Bhubaneswar. While youngsters shook a leg to desi beats played by the club DJ Rick, models walked down the ramps in rainbow-hued outfits. “We are not professional models but we walked the ramp just to experience something new,” said Anisha and Chinmaye, enthusiastic participants at the event. The show, which had three sequences themed on Indian ethnic, casual and floral-printed fabric, was followed by some energetic dance performances. “Bhubaneswar has got smitten by the party culture. The crowd is far more energetic now,” said Deepak Kumar, a regular party-goer. Said Pratik Mohapatra, who had organized the event, “I never realized that the party would be such a hit when I planned it. I am waiting to host more such dos now."Sayamsiddha MohapatraDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation to rep.description: BHUBANESWAR: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to coordinate the repair work of three Fani-hit schools under its jurisdiction that suffered the maximum damage. These three schools include the Ekamra Vihar Primary School in Kharvel Nagar, Janatanagar Primary School near Salia Sahi and Bharatiya Vidyalaya in Unit III. The decision was taken after the district education office of Khurda requested the BMC administrator to take up the repair work of the three schools in order to ensure that they can be opened on time after the summer break on June 18. "I want to bring to your kind notice that Cyclone Fani caused extensive damage to the educational infrastructure in the BMC area. Many schools were damaged and need immediate action," the request letter issued by the district office said. "It is requested that immediate repair work be taken up so that classes can start once the summer vacation is over. Kindly instruct the BMC commissioner to start the work at the earliest," the letter said. As per the damage assessment by the school and mass education department, the asbestos roofs of the two primary schools were damaged while the compound wall of Bharatiya Vidyalaya collapsed during the cyclone. A senior civic body official said they have already started coordinating the repair work. "The roofs of the two primary schools will be rebuilt on a priority basis," the official said. It must be noted that as many as 6,498 schools were damaged in the cyclone across 14 affected districts including Khurda. "Most of the schools have already received the necessary repair," an official of school and mass education department said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSrinibas Satapathy and M Simadri perfo.description: It was a very different experience for the music lovers of the city as they witnessed the melodious jugalbandi of flute and saxophone, played by Srinibas Satapathy and M Simadri respectively. The occasion was the 33rd Barsha Festival. “It was my first-ever performance at Rabindra Mandap and I am deeply honoured to perform here. I hope the audience loved to listen to Srinibas and me,” said M.Simadri. With the rains doing pitter-patter throughout the evening, the musicians celebrated monsoon in their own special way. “I have never had the opportunity to listen to a flute and a saxophone playing together and the experience was just fabulous. It felt like the duo had invited the rains with their music,” said Jitendra Parida from the audience. During the second half of the evening, students of Utkal University of Culture performed Odissi. The dancers would be happy to know that their performances impressed some Turkish students including Emine, Zehra, Nursan and Esra. In fact, this group of students have now decided to watch Odissi performances on a regular basis. “My friends and I were here just to get a glimpse of the local events. We must say that the performances have delighted us. Now, we are planning to come to this auditorium frequently to enjoy all these local cultural events,” shared Emine. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Stung by assembly polls defeat, BJP begi.description: BHUBANESWAR: As the BJP on Sunday tried to scramble for reasons for the below-expectation performance in the state assembly election-though it swept the LS poll across the country-there was unanimity among the party's senior leaders that its grassroots presence is still way behind its arch rival BJD in the state. In the simultaneous polls, the BJD won in 112 of 147 assembly seats and 12 of 21 LS seats while the BJP got 23 assembly seats and 8 LS seats. The core meeting attended by Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan, state BJP president Basanta Panda, party's Odisha in-charge Arun Singh and national vice-president Baijayant Panda, among others, decided that the party's membership drive will resume from July. "A mechanism will be worked out to engage the members in various activities so that the membership doesn't remain only on pen and papers," a senior BJP leader said. The BJP decided that party's office-bearers will hold meetings at the level of all 21 Lok Sabha seats and submit assembly-wise performance report, factors that worked and things that went against. Starting with an aggressive campaign for the deferred assembly poll in Patkura and by-poll in Bijepur, necessitated by chief minister Naveen Patnaik's resignation there retaining his usual seat Hinjili, the BJP would pursue political activities all the five years. Former BJP MLA Pradeep Purohit, who was present in the meeting, said "Despite strong wave for Narendra Modi, we could not capitalise on it by taking his good works to people at the grassroots besides highlighting the failures of Naveen Patnaik government more effectively." The BJP workers will work to take the welfare initiatives of Narendra Modi government to the grassroots and continue works keeping the unfinished agenda of 'Mission 120+,' the campaign to win at least 120 assembly seats in Odisha, he said. Speaking to reporters after the meeting, party's state general secretary Prithviraj Harichandan said, "The defeat was reviewed. Focus of the discussion was required efforts to strengthen party organisations at the village level." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\n\u201cTumari smrutire\u201d event in B.description: On the occasion of the ongoing celebration of the 69th birth anniversary of danseuse Sanjukta Panigrahi, the Sanjukta and Raghunath Panigrahi Cultural Heritage Foundation organized a cultural programme titled “Tumari smrutire.” Eminent Odissi dancer Kavita Dwivedi, along with other noted dancers like Sharon Lowen, Adyasa Mishra and Pushpita Mishra, mesmerized the audience with their Odissi performances. “I have performed Odissi throughout the world. But, whenever I perform in Odisha, it feels like I’m sitting for a test. It’s very important for me that the audience here should like my performance,” said Kavita. Sharon Lowen agreed with her, insisting, “Odissi is not a mere movement of the body and expressions of the eyes. It’s like bringing the feeling of godliness while dancing. Dancers and the audience should experience it.” It seems that their effort to engage the audience in their performances bore fruit. Rupali Das, a dance love, was thoroughly impressed by the performances. “It was fantastic to see all these great dancers perform. They all were at their best and I enjoyed my evening very much,” she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Naveen talks women\u2019s empowerment, s.description: BHUBANESWAR: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday urged the Niti Aayog Governing Council to strive towards empowering women while also advocating simultaneous elections in the country, a point raised by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the past. “We must move towards empowering women in all spheres,” a government statement quoted Naveen as saying at the Niti Aayog meeting, which was chaired by Modi. It must be mentioned that the BJD president has been advocating women’s empowerment at various forums and had also taken up the issue of women’s reservation in Parliament and state assemblies during Modi’s first term as Prime Minister. True to his word, Naveen’s party fielded seven women candidates, or one-third of the 21 Lok Sabha seats that went to polls in Odisha. Out of the seven, five women managed to win. Reviving the ‘one nation, one election’ idea mooted by Modi in the past, Naveen said, “As frequent elections affect development climate, it is better to have simultaneous elections in the country.” In 2004, Naveen had advanced the Odisha assembly election to sync it with the Lok Sabha election, despite the fact that his tenure as chief minister was to end a year later. Since then Odisha has been witnessing assembly and Lok Sabha elections together. Reiterating his demand for special category status for Odisha — which he had raised during his meeting with Modi on Tuesday — Naveen proposed to include natural calamity as a criteria for granting such a status. “As an interim measure, states hit by major natural calamities may be declared as ‘Special Focus States’ and granted benefits of Special Category Status for a specific period,” the statement added. Stating that primary sector, especially agriculture, has to be taken care of, the chief minister said, “Judicious utilisation of water resources holds the key.” Naveen also advised the governing council to bring all irrigation projects which are lying incomplete as on April 1, 2019 under the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY). He also suggested that the PM-KISAN scheme, the Centre’s cash assistance for farmers, should include landless agriculture households and share-croppers, just like the Odisha government has done with its Kalia (Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation) initiative that has received widespread praise. Byelections to 3 Rajya Sabha seats in Od.description: BHUBANESWAR: Byelection to three Rajya Sabha seats in the state, vacated by Achyuta Samanta, Soumya Ranjan Patnaik and Pratap Keshari Deb, will be held on July 5. Patnaik and Deb resigned from the Upper House after they were elected to the 16th state assembly. Samanta vacated the seat after he became a Lok Sabha member from Kandhamal. The tenure of Patnaik and Samanta was to end in April 2024, while that of Deb was to end in July 2022. Though actor Anubhav Mohanty also resigned from the Rajya Sabha after being elected to the Lok Sabha from Kendrapada, there will be no byelection for his seat as less than a year is left for the completion of his tenure. Mohanty’s Rajya Sabha term will end in April next year. Notification for the byelection will be issued on June 18. The last date to file nomination is June 25. On July 5, election will be held from 9 am to 4 pm. Going by the number of MLAs in the assembly, BJD will comfortably retain all three Rajya Sabha seats. Many senior party leaders, who were denied tickets during the recent polls, are eyeing Rajya Sabha berths. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhubaneswar: BMC starts training sanitat.description: BHUBANESWAR: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Monday started its two-day training programme for all the sanitation workers engaged in 67 wards across the city to make them aware about the Solid Waste Management Rules-2016. On the first day, training were imparted to more than 600 sanitation workers from the BMC-managed 10 wards in the first session and over 600 from Ramky-managed 15 wards in the second session held at Unit VIII community centre. On the second day, the other two private sanitation agencies PMR and Jagruti will be included. Duration of a training session is two hours. On Friday, the BMC had conducted a training programme of officials, community organisers and zonal officials on the Solid Waste Management Rules-2016 following a directive from the National Green Tribunal (NGT) on imparting the training among all the staff. The second step was to train the grassroots-level sanitation workers. Swachh Bhubaneswar Abhiyan (SBA) Cell of the civic body organised the training programme in Odia language so that the workers can understand the importance of door-to-door collection of garbage, separation of bio-degradable and non-biodegradable wastes, plastic menace in our environment and its adverse impact across the globe. The trainers also taught them for better implementation of SWM Rules 2016, use of different coloured dustbins for different waste types, street sweeping norms and strict `no’ to burning of the municipal solid waste along the streets. Last week, the housing and urban development department had imparted training on all the urban local bodies of the state so that they can implement NGT order to all staff including the sweepers and `jamadars’ for better implementation of the SWM Rule-2016. NGT had directed all states and union territories in January this year to implement SWM Rules-2016 in letter and spirit to reduce pollution. Training to sanitation workers is one of the components of the rule, so the civic body conducted the programmes. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Counseling balm for kids in trauma in Fa.description: BHUBANESWAR: Ten-year-old Visakha Rao can still hear the wind howl in her sleep. When she does, she clutches a pillow for comfort. While a few months ago, her face would light up at the sight of the Puri beach, now even the mention of it sends a shiver down her spine. Like Visakha, thousands of children in Odisha are suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) more than a month after cyclonic storm Fani hit the state on May 3. In Puri, where the cyclone made landfall and damage was the greatest, more than 10,000 children below 17 years of age are undergoing psychosocial counseling after they started showing symptoms ranging from anxiety and stress to insomnia. Experts have warned that it might take a long time for an entire generation to overcome the mental trauma they have suffered in the aftermath of Fani which claimed 64 lives. At least 300 counselors from six non-profit organisations - aided by the government - have set up temporary centres in Puri alone to provide mental health intervention to affected children. While much of the infrastructure damaged by Fani is being rebuilt and those displaced have returned home, memories of the raging storm still haunt them. "We were without food, power and water for several days. I never want to live through that again," Soumendra, a 12-year-old boy, who has been undergoing counseling, told TOI. Having come face-to-face with the monstrosity of the sea, he is scared to venture out alone. "I feel safe here. The sound of the waves crashing onto the shore disturbs me," he said. It is this fear that gives Soumendra sleepless nights, a common symptom of PTSD. "Children with PTSD fear that they would have to go through the same experience. If the anxiety persists for a prolonged period, they may slip into acute depression," Suvendu Mishra, general secretary of Indian Psychiatric Society (Odisha state branch), said. Mishra added that around 35% to 40% of the children in affected areas showed such symptoms and it may take anything between three and six months to fully recover. \nHarihar Deo enthralls the audience at.description: Last Saturday, partyhoppers of Bhubaneswar witnessed a very different kind of dance event. A group of some differently-abled dancers performed at a city nightclub and left the partygoers suitably impressed.  Harihar Deo and his troupe provided the evening’s entertainment by performing on Teri meri, Munni badnaam hui, Dhinka chika and lots more. Their performances were followed by a hip-hop show by the group UDT (United Dancing Twisterz) Crew. The guy doing handstands was cheered for most. Later DJ Ravi took the stage. His pulsating music brought everybody to the dance floor. DJ Partho performed after him. Lipsa, a pretty lass from the crowd told BT, “I was here to celebrate my birthday. After watching these amazing people perform and later dancing on such good music made my day special.”Swayamsiddha MohapatraDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Encephalitis.description: Bihar is in the grip of Encephalitis. At least 108 children have lost their lives due to acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in its Muzaffarpur district. AES accompanies flu-like symptoms such as high fever, headaches and convulsions. Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is the major cause of AES in India besides other sources such as bacteria, fungus, parasites, spirochetes, chemicals, toxins, and non infectious agents. Here's more. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nRock band competition organized in Bhu.description: It was time for some rock ’n’ roll for Bhubaneswar music lovers as a city club organized a rock band competition. Bands both from and outside Odisha participated in the event. A huge crowd gathered at the club and cheered on loudly when the bands — Despite Premonition and 666 from Bhubaneswar and Mind Eras(H)er from Kolkata — competed against each other. Ultimately, Mind Eras(H)er’s energetic performance on tracks like, “My girl with someone else” and “Tera emotional atyachar”, helped them bag the winner’s title. “We are really very happy to win this competition as the other bands were equally good. We have been performing throughout the country and this is our seventh trip to Odisha. It’s very satisfactory to perform in Bhubaneswar as the crowd response is very encouraging for a new band like us,” said Prince, the lead vocalist of Mind Eras(H)er. An interesting fact about them is, they are a seven-month-old band and they have won 19 competitions in five months, four of which were held in Odisha. While Odisha is close to their heart, are they open to composing for Ollywood? To this Prince said, “Though we haven’t yet got any offers, we are game.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country.
